item.title: Benefit fraud, 24th September
item.description:
Oriental woman has boyfriend living in flats to left in block 29. He lives in 29 another tall skinny oriental male but spends nights in 27 . Clearly a couple living in 2 separate flats and claiming as singles.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Trowbridge Road, Hackney, London

item.description:

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (offensive)

item.title: Three unnecessary bumps in road, 24th September
item.description:
On West Heath Avenue beside the junction with West Heath Road three bumps have been created by tarmac being poured over manholes. The original manhole covers can be seen on Street View (about 5 years old). These bumps are uncomfortable to cycle over, or one tries to cycle around them. It is surely not valid to create de facto road bumps like this as collateral effect, without due process.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Avenue, Golders Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Persistent rubbish and dog bags here, 24th September
item.description:
The foot and cycle path across Deptford creek is always littered including with dog poo bags as well as other rubbish. It clearly needs a permanent council bin which would reduce the amount hugely and discourage irresponsible behaviour. This should also increase efficiency for the street cleaning team as they wouldn't have to weekly gather up diffusely strewn litter. I raised a report here earlier in the year and the area was cleaned up but a permanent bin is really needed. I have also asked for one on the greenwich side
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ha'penny Hatch, Deptford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish Bin removed why? Put it back., 24th September
item.description:
There was a public rubbish bin in front of the shop . People used to throw rubbish in it as they exited the shop after buying sweets, chocolate wrappers .Now people are leaving the shop and throwing their wrappers on the floor and attracting vermin.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Felstead Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridge freezer and rubbish left in road, 24th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Foxhole Road, Well Hall, London

item.title: Persistent litter, please site a permanent bin here, 24th September
item.description:
I raised this issue last week and it was closed with a note that it would be "resolved in the next weekly clean". The foot and cycle path across Deptford creek is always littered including with dog poo bags as well as other rubbish. It clearly needs a permanent council bin which would reduce the amount hugely and discourage irresponsible behaviour. This should also increase efficiency for the street cleaning team as they wouldn't have to weekly gather up diffusely strewn litter
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ha'penny Hatch, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned 125cc bike in private car park, 24th September
item.description:
Abandoned 125cc bike in private car park, does not belong to any residents. Has been abandoned there for over 3 months. Located in the private car park through the alleyway between 8 and 10 THE VILLAGE SE7, access can also be gained from TORRANCE CLOSE SE7

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, The Village, Charlton, London
